at0000.1.1.description: *Document to communicate information to others about the result of a test or assessment.(en)
*Document to communicate information to others about the result of a test or assessment.(en)
Document to communicate information to others about the result of a test or assessment.
*Document to communicate information to others about the result of a test or assessment.(en)
Dokument for å formidle informasjon til andre om svaret på en prøve eller undersøkelse.
Documento para comunicar informações sobre o resultado de um teste ou avaliação.
Das Dokument wird verwendet, um Informationen über das Ergebnis eines Tests oder einer Bewertung zu übermitteln.
테스트나 평가의 결과에 대해 다른 사람들과 정보를 통신하는 문서.

at0000.1.description: Suggested design pattern for including diagnostic test results in a template.

at0101.1.description: *Additional narrative about the test result not captured in other fields.(en)

at0000.1.description: The result, including findings and the laboratory's interpretation, of an investigation performed on specimens collected from an individual or related to that individual.

at0101.1.description: Additional narrative about the test result not captured in other fields.

at0000.1.description: Resultat, inkludert funn og laboratoriets tolkning, av en laboratorieundersøkelse utført på prøvemateriale fra et individ eller relatert til individet.

at0101.1.description: Tekstlig tilleggsinformasjon om analyseresultatet, som ikke er registrert i andre felt.

at0000.1.description: *The result, including findings and interpretation, of a laboratory investigation performed on specimens from individuals or related materials(en)

at0101.1.description: *Additional narrative about the test result not captured in other fields.(en)

at0000.1.description: Das Ergebnis - einschließlich der Befunde und der Interpretation des Labors - einer Untersuchung, die an Proben durchgeführt wurde, die von einer Einzelperson stammen oder mit dieser Person zusammenhängen.

at0101.1.description: Weitere Informationen über das Laborergebnis, welche bisher nicht in den anderen Feldern erfasst wurden.

at0000.1.description: L'esito, inclusi i risultati e l'interpretazione, di una indagine di laboratorio effettuata su campioni provenienti da individui o relativi materiali.

at0101.1.description: Narrativa aggiuntiva sul risultato del test non catturato in altri campi.

at0000.1.description: *The result, including findings and the laboratory's interpretation, of an investigation performed on specimens collected from an individual or related to that individual.(en)

at0101.1.description: *Additional narrative about the test result not captured in other fields.(en)

at0000.1.description: Resultatet, inklusive fynd och laboratoriets tolkning, av en undersökning utförd på provmaterial från en individ eller relaterad till individen.

at0101.1.description: Ytterligare berättande textuell beskrivning om undersökningsresultatet, som inte registrerats i andra fält.

at0000.1.description: O resultado, incluindo achados e a interpretação do laboratório, de uma investigação realizada em amostras coletadas de um indivíduo ou relacionadas a esse indivíduo.

at0101.1.description: *Additional narrative about the test result not captured in other fields.(en)

author.name: Vebjørn Arntzen/Silje Ljosland Bakke/Liv Laugen
author.organisation: Oslo universitetssykehus HF/Nasjonal IKT HF/Oslo universitetssykehus, Norway

author.name: Alessandro Sulis/Francesca Frexia/Cecilia Mascia
author.organisation: CRS4 - Center for advanced studies, research and development in Sardinia, Pula (Cagliari), Italy

at0000.1.description: *A specimen collected from an individual or related to that individual. (en)
at0000.1.comment: *For example: Tissue, body fluid or food. (en)

at0015.1.description: *The date and time that collection has been ordered to take place or has taken place.(en)
at0015.1.comment: *This datetime will be captured primarily in the INSTRUCTION timing, ACTION time or OBSERVATION times. However, as this is a critical piece of information, it can be useful to also associate it directly with the specimen itself. (en)

at0000.1.description: A physical sample collected from, or related to, an individual for the purpose of investigation, examination or analysis.
at0000.1.comment: For example: Tissue or body fluid.

at0015.1.description: The date and time that collection has been ordered to take place or has taken place.
at0015.1.comment: This datetime will be captured primarily in the INSTRUCTION timing, ACTION time or OBSERVATION times. However, as this is a critical piece of information, it can be useful to also associate it directly with the specimen itself.

at0000.1.description: *A specimen collected from an individual or related to that individual. (en)
at0000.1.comment: *For example: Tissue, body fluid or food. (en)

at0015.1.description: A data e horário em que a coleta foi solicitada ou realizada.
at0015.1.comment: *This datetime will be captured primarily in the INSTRUCTION timing, ACTION time or OBSERVATION times. However, as this is a critical piece of information, it can be useful to also associate it directly with the specimen itself. (en)

at0000.1.description: Et fysisk prøvemateriale tatt fra eller relatert til et individ, for undersøkelse eller analyse.
at0000.1.comment: For eksempel kroppsvev eller kroppsvæske.

at0015.1.description: Dato og tid for når prøvetakingen skal skje, eller har skjedd.
at0015.1.comment: Denne dato/tidsregistreringen vil primært registreres i forbindelse med INSTRUCTION-timing, ACTION-tid, eller OBSERVATION-tider. Imidlertid er dette en kritisk informasjonsbit, og det kan være nyttig å ha mulighet til å også knytte den direkte til prøvematerialet.

at0000.1.description: Eine physikalische Probe zur Prüfung, Untersuchung oder Analyse, die von einer Person entnommen wurde oder die sich auf die Person bezieht.
at0000.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: Gewebe oder Körperflüssigkeit.

at0015.1.description: Das Datum und die Uhrzeit, zu der die Probennahme angeordnet wurde oder stattfand.
at0015.1.comment: Dieser Zeitpunkt wird hauptsächlich in den Zeitangaben, von INSTRUCTION, ACTION oder OBSERVATION erfasst. Da es sich jedoch um eine wichtige Information handelt, kann es nützlich sein, diese auch direkt mit der Probe selbst zu verknüpfen.

at0000.1.description: Ett fysiskt prov/provmaterial taget från, eller relaterat till, en individ i syfte att utföra en bedömning, undersökning eller analys.
at0000.1.comment: Exempelvis vävnad eller kroppsvätska.

at0015.1.description: Datum och tid för när provtagningen ska äga rum eller har ägt rum.
at0015.1.comment: Datum/tid kommer främst att anges i arketyper av typerna INSTRUCTION, ACTION eller OBSERVATION. Detta är dock en kritisk informationsdel och därför det kan vara användbart att ha möjlighet att också länka den direkt till provmaterialet.

author.name: Sarah Ballout, Antje Wulff, Natalia Strauch
author.organisation: PLRI for Medical Informatics Medical School Hannover and TU Braunschweig, Medizinische Hochschule Hannover

author.name: Linda Aulin, Erik Sundvall
author.organisation: Region Stockholm, Karolinska Institutet + Karolinska University Hospital, Region Stockholm + Linköping University

author.name: Kristian Berg, Gro-Hilde Ulriksen, Line Silsand, Silje Ljosland Bakke, Liv Laugen
author.organisation: Universitetssykehuset Nord-Norge, Helse Vest IKT AS, ​Oslo University Hospital, Norway

author.name: Adriana Kitajima, Débora Farage, Fernanda Maia, Laíse Figueiredo, Marivan Abrahão

at0001.1.description: The value of the analyte result.
at0001.1.comment: For example '7.3 mmol/l', 'Raised'. The 'Any' data type will need to be constrained to an appropriate data type in a specialisation, a template or at run-time to reflect the actual analyte result. The Quantity data type has reference model attributes that include flags for normal/abnormal, reference ranges and approximations - see https://specifications.openehr.org/releases/RM/latest/data_types.html#_dv_quantity_class for more details.

at0004.1.description: Additional advice on the applicability of the reference range to this result or may carry text or coded textual guidance as to whether the result is within the normal range.
at0004.1.comment: For example, 'within normal limits for age and sex'.

at0003.1.description: Additional narrative about the analyte result, not captured in other fields.

at0001.1.comment: For eksempel "7,3 mmol/L" eller "Forhøyet". Datatypen "Udefinert datatype" må begrenses til en passende datatype i en spesialisering, et templat eller i applikasjonen. Datatypen Quantity har attributter fra referansemodellen som dekker flagg for normalt/unormalt, referanseområder og approksimeringer. Se https://specifications.openehr.org/releases/RM/latest/data_types.html#_dv_quantity_class for mer detaljer.

at0004.1.description: Veileder for å finne ut om referanseverdien er relevant for dette resultatet. Kan inneholde tekst eller kodet tekstlig råd for om resultatet ligger innenfor normalområdet.
at0004.1.comment: For eksempel "innenfor normale grenseverdier i forhold til alder og kjønn".

at0003.1.description: Ytterligere fritekst om analyseresultatet som ikke fanges opp av andre elementer.

at0001.1.comment: *For example '7.3 mmol/l', 'Raised'. The 'Any' data type will need to be constrained to an appropriate data type in a specialisation, a template or at run-time to reflect the actual analyte result. The Quantity data type has reference model attributes that include flags for normal/abnormal, reference ranges and approximations - see https://specifications.openehr.org/releases/RM/latest/data_types.html#_dv_quantity_class for more details.(en)

at0004.1.description: *Additional advice on the applicability of the reference range to this result or may carry text or coded textual guidance as to whether the result is within the normal range.(en)
at0004.1.comment: *For example, 'within normal limits for age and sex'.(en)

at0003.1.description: *Additional narrative about the analyte result, not captured in other fields.(en)

at0001.1.comment: Z.B. "7,3 mmol/l", "Erhöht". Der "Any"-Datentyp wird dann durch eine Spezialisierung, eine Vorlage oder zur Laufzeit der Anwendung auf einen passenden Datentyp eingeschränkt werden müssen, um das aktuelle Analyt-Ergebnis wiederzugeben. Der "Quantity"-Datentyp hat Referenzmodell-Attribute, wie Kennungen für normal/abnormal, Referenzbereiche und Näherungen - für weitere Details s. https://specifications.openehr.org/releases/RM/latest/data_types.html#_dv_quantity_class .

at0004.1.description: Zusätzliche Hinweise zur Anwendbarkeit des Referenzbereichs für dieses Resultat oder (codierter) Text, ob das Ergebnis im Referenzbereich ist oder nicht.
at0004.1.comment: z.B.: 'im Referenzbereich, bezogen auf Alter und Geschlecht'.

at0003.1.description: Kommentar zum Analyt-Ergebnis, soweit noch nicht in anderen Feldern erfasst.

at0001.1.description: De waarde van een analyt uitslag.
at0001.1.comment: Bijvoorbeeld: '7.3 mmol/l', 'Verhoogd'. Om het daadwerkelijke analyt result weer te geven dient het 'Any' data type gespecificeerd te worden tot een toepasselijk data type in een specialisatie, een template of terwijl de applicatie loopt.

at0004.1.description: Extra advies over de toepasselijkheid van het referentiebereik van deze uitslag; mag ook een textuele of gecodeerd textuele aanwijzing bevatten of het resultaat binnen het normale bereik valt.
at0004.1.comment: Bijvoorbeeld: 'binnen het normale bereik voor leeftijd en geslacht'

at0003.1.description: Extra beschrijving van de analyt uitslag, die niet past binnen andere velden.

at0001.1.comment:
Till exempel "7,3 mmol/L" eller "Förhöjd". Datatypen "Any", som är en odefinierad datatyp, måste begränsas till en lämplig datatyp i en specialisering, mall eller applikation. Datatypen "Quantity" har attribut från referensmodellen som täcker flaggor för normal/onormal, referensområden och approximationer.
Se https://specifications.openehr.org/releases/RM/latest/data_types.html#_dv_quantity_class för mer information.

at0004.1.description: Ytterligare vägledning för information om referensintervallet är tillämpbart för detta resultat. Kan innehålla text eller kodad text med råd om huruvida resultatet ligger inom det normala intervallet.
at0004.1.comment: Till exempel "inom normalområde avseende ålder och kön".

at0003.1.description: Ytterligare fritext om analysresultatet som inte fångas av andra dataelement.

author.name: Michael Lieser, Antje Wulff, Natalia Strauch
author.organisation: Department of Infectious Diseases, Heidelberg University Hospital, Medizinische Hochschule Hannover

author.name: Linda Aulin, Linda Aulin Lundeqvist

author.name: Adriana Kitajima, Débora Farage, Fernanda Maia, Laíse Figueiredo, Marivan Abrahão

at0000.1.description: Framework for consistent modelling of content within a template for a Problem list.
at0000.1.comment: Intended to be used within the COMPOSITION.problem_list.

at0000.1.description: *Framework for consistent modelling of content within a template for a Problem list. (en)
*Framework for consistent modelling of content within a template for a Problem list. (en)
Framework für die konsistente Modellierung von Inhalten in einem Template für eine Problemliste.
at0000.1.comment: Für die Verwendung in der COMPOSITION.problem_list.

author.name: Alan March
author.organisation: Hospital Universiatario Austral, Pilar, Buenos Aires, Argentina.

author.name: Adriana Kitajima, Débora Farage, Fernanda Maia, Laíse Figueiredo, Marivan Abrahão

at0000.1.description: *Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.(en)
at0000.1.comment: *Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.(en)

at0002.1.description: *Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.(en)
at0002.1.comment: *Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)

at0000.1.description: Detalles acerca de una condición de salud, lesión, incapacidad o cualquier otra cuerstión, univocamente identificadas, que impacta sobre el bienestar físico, mental y/o social de un individuo
at0000.1.comment: La delineación entre el alcance de un problema versus el diagnóstico puede no ser fácil de lograr en la práctica. A los fines de la documentación clínica mediante este arquetipo, problema y diagnóstico son considerados un continuo, donde niveles incrementales de detalles y evidencia de apoyo otorgan mas peso a la etiqueta de "diagnóstico".

at0002.1.description: Identificación del problema o diagnóstico, por nombre.
at0002.1.comment: Se prefiere la codificación del nombre del problema o diagnóstico mediante una terminología cuando esto sea posible.

at0009.1.description: Descripción narrativa del problema o diagnóstico.
at0009.1.comment: Utilizar para proveer trasfondo y contexto, incluyendo evolución, episodios o exacerbaciones, progreso y cualquier otro detalles relevante acerca del problema o diagnóstico.

at0000.1.description: Angaben über einen einzelnen identifizierten Gesundheitszustand, eine Verletzung, eine Behinderung oder ein Problem, welches das körperliche, geistige und/oder soziale Wohlergehen einer Einzelperson beeinträchtigt.
at0000.1.comment: Eine klare Abgrenzung zwischen Problem und Diagnose ist in der Praxis nicht einfach zu erreichen. Für die Zwecke der klinischen Dokumentation mit diesem Archetyp werden Problem und Diagnose als ein Kontinuum betrachtet, mit zunehmendem Detaillierungsgrad und unterstützenden Beweisen, die in der Regel dem Etikett "Diagnose" Gewicht verleihen.

at0002.1.description: Namentliche Identifikation des Problems oder der Diagnose.
at0002.1.comment: Wo möglich, ist die Kodierung des Problems oder der Diagnose über eine Terminologie zu bevorzugen.

at0009.1.description: Beschreibung des Problems oder der Diagnose.
at0009.1.comment: Wird verwendet, um Hintergrund und Kontext, einschließlich Entwicklung, Episoden oder Verschlechterungen, Fortschritt und andere relevante Details über das Problem oder die Diagnose zu liefern.

at0000.1.description: Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.
at0000.1.comment: Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.

at0002.1.description: Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.
at0002.1.comment: Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

at0009.1.description: Narrative description about the problem or diagnosis.
at0009.1.comment: Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.

at0000.1.description: *Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.(en)
at0000.1.comment: *Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.(en)

at0002.1.description: *Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.(en)
at0002.1.comment: *Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)

at0009.1.description: *Narrative description about the problem or diagnosis.(en)
at0009.1.comment: *Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.(en)

at0000.1.description: Detalhes sobre uma única condição de saúde identificada, lesões, deficiência ou qualquer outra questão que tenha impacto sobre o bem-estar físico, mental e / ou social de um indivíduo.
at0000.1.comment: Delimitação clara entre o âmbito de um problema em comparação a um diagnóstico, não é fácil de se conseguir na prática. Para fins de documentação clínica com este arquétipo, problema e diagnóstico são considerados como uma continuidade, com níveis crescentes de detalhes e evidência de apoio, geralmente fornecendo peso para o rótulo de "diagnóstico".

at0002.1.description: Identificação do problema ou diagnóstico, por nome.
at0002.1.comment: Quando possível, é preferível usar a codificação do nome do problema ou diagnóstico com uma terminologia.

at0009.1.description: Descrição narrativa sobre o problema ou diagnóstico.
at0009.1.comment: Usar para fornecer conhecimento e contexto, incluindo evolução, episódios ou exacerbações, progresso e quaisquer outros detalhes relevantes, sobre o problema ou diagnóstico.

at0000.1.description: Detaljer om én identifisert helsetilstand, skade, funksjonshemming eller annet forhold som påvirker et individs fysiske, mentale og/eller sosiale velvære.
at0000.1.comment: Det er i praksis ikke lett å oppnå et klart skille mellom et problem og en diagnose. I klinisk dokumentasjon med denne arketypen ses problem og diagnose som et kontinuum, med økende krav til detaljer og støttende evidens for å underbygge en diagnose.

at0002.1.description: Identifisering av problemet eller diagnosen ved hjelp av navn.
at0002.1.comment: Koding av navnet på problemet eller diagnosen med en terminologi er foretrukket, der det er mulig.

at0009.1.comment: Brukes til å gi bakgrunn og kontekst, inkludert utvikling, episoder eller forverringer, fremgang og alle andre relevante detaljer, om problemet eller diagnosen.

at0000.1.description: Detaljer av ett enskilt identifierat hälsotillstånd, skada, funktionshinder eller något annat problem som påverkar individens fysiska, psykiska och eller sociala välbefinnande.
at0000.1.comment: Det är inte lätt att i praktiken uppnå en tydlig avgränsning mellan ett problem och en diagnos. Vid tillämpning av klinisk dokumentation med denna arketyp betraktas problem och diagnos som ett kontinuum, med plats för fler detaljer och stödjande bevis som vanligtvis ger tyngd till etiketten ”diagnos”.

at0002.1.description: Identifiering av problemet eller diagnosen efter namn.
at0002.1.comment: Kodning av namnet på problemet eller diagnosen med en terminologi är att föredra, om det är tillämpligt.

at0009.1.description: En beskrivning av problemet eller diagnosen.
at0009.1.comment: Används för att ge bakgrund och kontext, inklusive utveckling, episoder eller exacerbationer, framsteg och andra relevanta detaljer om problemet eller diagnosen.

at0000.1.description: 한 개인의 신체, 정신 그리고/또는 사회적 웰빙에 영향을 주는 단일한 확인된 건강 성태, 상해, 장애 또는 다른 이슈에 대한 상세내용.
at0000.1.comment: 실무에서 문제와 진단의 범위 간의 명확한 구분을 하기 쉽지 않음. 이 아키타입을 통한 임상 문서의 목적을 위해서, 증가하는 상세내용의 수준과 일반적으로 '진단'의 표시에 대한 무게감을 제공하는 지지할 수 있는 증거를 가지고, 문제와 진단은 연속된 것(a continuum)으로 간주됨.

at0002.1.description: 명칭으로 문제 또는 진단의 식별.
at0002.1.comment: 가능하다면, 용어체계를 통한 문제 또는 진단의 명칭을 코딩하는 것이 좋음.

at0009.1.description: 문제 또는 진단에 대한 서술 기록.
at0009.1.comment: 문제와 진단에 대한 진화(evolution)와 에피소드 또는 악화, 경과를 포함한 배경과 문액 그리고 다른 관련된 상세내용을 제공하는데 사용함.

at0000.1.description: Yksityiskohdat yksittäisestä tunnistetusta terveystilasta, vammasta, vammasta tai muusta aiheesta, joka vaikuttaa yksilön fyysiseen, henkiseen ja / tai sosiaaliseen hyvinvointiin.
at0000.1.comment: *Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.(en)

at0002.1.description: Ongelman tai diagnoosin tunnistaminen nimellä.
at0002.1.comment: *Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)

at0009.1.comment: *Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.(en)

at0000.1.description: Dettagli su una specifica condizione di salute, una lesione, una disabilità o un qualsiasi altro problema individuato su un individuo che abbia un impatto sul benessere fisico, mentale e/o sociale.
at0000.1.comment: Nella pratica, non è facile fare una distinzione netta tra gli ambiti dei concetti 'problema' e 'diagnosi'. Ai fini della documentazione clinica con questo archetipo, problema e diagnosi sono considerati un continuum, con livelli crescenti di dettagli ed evidenze a supporto a supporto dell'etichetta 'diagnosi'.

at0002.1.description: Nome/identificativo del problema o della diagnosi.
at0002.1.comment: Si preferisce, ove possibile, la codifica del problema o diagnosi con una terminologia.

at0009.1.description: Descrizione narrativa del problema o della diagnosi.
at0009.1.comment: Utilizzare questo campo per fornire il background e il contesto, compresa l'evoluzione, gli episodi o le esacerbazioni, i progressi e qualsiasi altro dettaglio rilevante circa il problema o la diagnosi.

at0000.1.description: Informatie over een enkele vast te stellen medische aandoening, een letsel, beperking of andere zaak die invloed heeft op de fysieke, mentale en/of het sociale welbevinden van een individu.
at0000.1.comment: *Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.(en)

at0002.1.description: Identificatie van het probleem of de diagnose bij naam.
at0002.1.comment: *Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)

at0009.1.description: Verhalende beschrijving van het probleem of de diagnose.
at0009.1.comment: *Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.(en)

at0000.1.description: *Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts  the physical, mental and/or social wellbeing of an individual.(en)
at0000.1.comment: *Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.(en)

at0002.1.description: *Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.(en)
at0002.1.comment: *Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)

at0009.1.description: *Narrative description about the problem or diagnosis.(en)
at0009.1.comment: *Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.(en)

author.name: Aljoscha Kindermann, Jasmin Buck, Sebastian Garde, Natalia Strauch, Alina Rehberg
author.organisation: Universityhospital of Heidelberg, University of Heidelberg, Central Queensland University, Medizinische Hochschule Hannover

author.name: Alan March
author.organisation: Hospital Universitario Austral, Buenos Aires, Argentina

at0000.1.description: Narrative summary or overview about a patient, specifically from the perspective of a healthcare provider, and with or without associated interpretations.

at0002.1.description: The summary, assessment, conclusions or evaluation of the clinical findings.

at0000.1.description: خلاصه یا مروری تشریحی دربازه بیمار بویژه از نظز ارایه کننده مراقبت بهداشتی با یا بدون تفسیرهای مربوطه

at0002.1.description: خلاصه ، ارزیابی ، نتیجه ، یا ارزشیابی یافته های بالینی

at0000.1.description: ملخص بالرواية أو نظرة عامة عن المريض, خاصة من وجهة نظر مقدم الخدمة الصحية, مع إرفاق أو عدم إرفاق تفسيرات

at0002.1.description: الملخص, التقييم, الاستنتاجات أو التقييم للموجودات السريرية

at0000.1.description: Zusammenfassung oder Übersicht einer Patientengeschichte, speziell aus der Sicht eines Gesundheitsdienstleisters, evtl. mit dazugehörigen Interpretationen.

at0002.1.description: Die Zusammenfassung, Beurteilung, Aussagen or Auswertung des klinischen Befunds.

at0000.1.description: Sumario narrativo o visión global acerca de un paciente, específicamente desde la perspectiva de un profesional del cuidado de la salud, con o sin interpretaciones asociadas.

at0002.1.description: El sumario, la impresión diagnóstica y las conclusiones sobre los hallazgos clínicos.

at0000.1.description: Resumo narrativo ou visão geral sobre um paciente, especificamente a partir da perspectiva de um profissional de saúde, e com ou sem interpretações associadas.

at0002.1.description: O sumário, a avaliação, conclusões ou avaliação dos achados clínicos.

at0000.1.description: 从医疗保健服务提供着的角度，手工综合并记录关于患者的叙述型摘要或概述，且带有或没有相关联的解释。

at0002.1.description: 对于临床所见（临床发现）进行的概括、评估、总结或评价。

at0000.1.description: Fritekstsammendrag eller oversikt om en pasient fra helsepersonellets perspektiv, med eller uten tilhørende fortolkninger.

at0002.1.description: Oppsummering, vurdering, konklusjoner eller evaluering av de kliniske funnene.

at0000.1.description: Beskrivande sammanfattning eller överblick av en patient, särskilt ur vårdgivarens perspektiv, med eller utan associerade tolkningar.

at0002.1.description: Sammanfattning, bedömning, slutsatser eller utvärderingar av de kliniska fynden.
